title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Proverbs chapter 31 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Proverbs Chapter 31.

questions.question: Who taught king Lemuel the prophecy mentioned in Proverbs 31:1?
questions.correctAnswer: His mother
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:1 states that the prophecy was taught to king Lemuel by his mother.

questions.question: What is king Lemuel advised not to give his strength unto, according to Proverbs 31:3?
questions.correctAnswer: Women
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:3 warns not to give strength unto women, nor ways to that which destroyeth kings.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 31:4, what is not fitting for kings to drink?
questions.correctAnswer: Wine
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:4 says it is not for kings to drink wine, nor for princes strong drink.

questions.question: Why should kings avoid drinking wine and strong drink according to Proverbs 31:5?
questions.correctAnswer: They might forget the law
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:5 explains that drinking can cause them to forget the law and pervert judgment.

questions.question: Who should be given strong drink and wine according to Proverbs 31:6?
questions.correctAnswer: Those ready to perish
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:6 instructs giving strong drink to him that is ready to perish and wine to those of heavy hearts.

questions.question: What does the virtuous woman’s price compare to in Proverbs 31:10?
questions.correctAnswer: Far above rubies
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:10 states her price is far above rubies.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 31:11, what does the heart of her husband do?
questions.correctAnswer: Safely trusts in her
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:11 tells us the heart of her husband safely trusts in her.

questions.question: What kind of materials does the virtuous woman seek and work with according to Proverbs 31:13?
questions.correctAnswer: Wool and flax
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:13 says she seeketh wool and flax and worketh willingly with her hands.

questions.question: When does the virtuous woman rise to give meat to her household according to Proverbs 31:15?
questions.correctAnswer: While it is yet night
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:15 states she riseth while it is yet night to provide for her household.

questions.question: What does the virtuous woman do with her hands according to Proverbs 31:19?
options: Layeth her hands to the spindle
questions.correctAnswer: Layeth her hands to the spindle
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:19 says she layeth her hands to the spindle and holdeth the distaff.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 31:20 says the virtuous woman is generous to the poor and needy.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:20 states she stretcheth out her hand to the poor and needy, showing generosity.

questions.question: True or False: According to Proverbs 31:21, the virtuous woman is afraid of the snow for her household.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:21 says she is not afraid of the snow because her household is clothed with scarlet.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 31:25 says strength and honour are her clothing.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:25 states that strength and honour are her clothing.

questions.question: Complete this verse from Proverbs 31:30: 'Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain: but a woman that ______ the LORD, she shall be praised.'
questions.correctAnswer: feareth
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:30 states that a woman that feareth the LORD shall be praised.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 31:28, who calls the virtuous woman blessed?
questions.correctAnswer: Her children and husband
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:28 says her children and husband arise and call her blessed.

medium.title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Proverbs Chapter 31 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 31:10 teach us about recognizing true virtue in a spouse?
options: A virtuous woman is priceless, far above rubies
Virtue is less important than wealth
Beauty is the highest value in a spouse
Only kings can find virtuous partners
questions.correctAnswer: A virtuous woman is priceless, far above rubies
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:10 highlights the great value of a virtuous woman, stating her price is far above rubies, emphasizing the importance of inner character over material wealth or external beauty (also see verses 29-30).

questions.question: What biblical principle about leadership and self-control is taught in Proverbs 31:4-5?
options: Kings should avoid wine to maintain just judgment
Leaders should enjoy strong drink freely
Drinking strengthens the resolve of rulers
questions.correctAnswer: Kings should avoid wine to maintain just judgment
questions.explanation: Verses 4-5 caution kings against drinking wine or strong drink because it can cause them to forget the law and pervert justice, highlighting the need for self-control in leadership.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 31:8-9, how should believers act on behalf of those who cannot speak for themselves?
options: Speak up for the mute and judge righteously for the poor
Ignore the needs of the helpless
Only care for those who can repay you
questions.correctAnswer: Speak up for the mute and judge righteously for the poor
questions.explanation: These verses command believers to advocate for the voiceless and to administer justice fairly, emphasizing the Christian duty to care for the vulnerable (see also verses 20 and 28).

questions.question: What work ethic is portrayed by the virtuous woman in Proverbs 31:13-19?
options: She willingly works with her hands and provides for her household
She relies on others to provide
She only focuses on beauty and appearance
questions.correctAnswer: She willingly works with her hands and provides for her household
questions.explanation: These verses describe a diligent woman who seeks wool and flax, works cheerfully with her hands, and manages her household’s needs, teaching the value of industriousness and responsibility.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 31:15 teach about responsibility in family life?
options: She rises early to prepare food for her household and servants
She depends on others to prepare meals
She sleeps late and neglects her family
questions.correctAnswer: She rises early to prepare food for her household and servants
questions.explanation: Verse 15 shows the woman's commitment to her family by rising early to provide nourishment, demonstrating the biblical principle of caring diligently for one’s household (also see verses 27 and 28).

questions.question: What does Proverbs 31:20 teach us about generosity and compassion?
options: She stretches out her hands to the poor and needy
She focuses solely on her own wealth
questions.correctAnswer: She stretches out her hands to the poor and needy
questions.explanation: This verse emphasizes the virtue of generosity and compassion by showing that the woman actively reaches out to assist those in need, reflecting the biblical call to care for others (see verses 8-9).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 31:25, what spiritual qualities clothe the virtuous woman?
questions.correctAnswer: Strength and honour
questions.explanation: Verse 25 metaphorically describes strength and honour as her clothing, highlighting character and dignity as key spiritual qualities to rejoice in (also see verses 30-31).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 31:26 instruct us to speak and interact with others?
questions.correctAnswer: With wisdom and kindness
questions.explanation: This verse teaches that the woman opens her mouth with wisdom and that her speech is marked by kindness, encouraging believers to communicate thoughtfully and lovingly.

questions.question: What does Proverbs 31:27 reveal about the woman's attitude toward idleness?
options: She does not eat the bread of idleness
She often rests and avoids work
She depends on others to work for her
She wastes time on frivolous things
questions.correctAnswer: She does not eat the bread of idleness
questions.explanation: Verse 27 emphasizes the woman's diligence and responsibility by stating she avoids idleness, aligning with biblical teaching on the value of hard work (see also verses 13-19).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 31:28-29 show the impact of a virtuous woman on her family?
options: Her children and husband praise and call her blessed
Her family is indifferent toward her
She is considered less than others
questions.correctAnswer: Her children and husband praise and call her blessed
questions.explanation: These verses describe the respect and honor her family gives her, reflecting the biblical principle that a godly woman’s influence brings blessing and praise within her household.

questions.question: What warning does Proverbs 31:3 give regarding the use of one’s strength and ways?
options: Do not give your strength to women who destroy kings
Give your strength freely to everyone
Use your strength for personal gain only
questions.correctAnswer: Do not give your strength to women who destroy kings
questions.explanation: This verse advises restraint and cautions against misusing one’s strength and influence in ways that lead to destruction, especially warning young men and leaders to avoid temptation.

questions.question: How does Proverbs 31:16 illustrate wise stewardship and planning?
options: She considers a field, buys it, and plants a vineyard
She waits for others to provide
questions.correctAnswer: She considers a field, buys it, and plants a vineyard
questions.explanation: Verse 16 shows that the woman exercises good judgment and foresight by investing in land and cultivating it, teaching biblical principles of stewardship and diligence.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 31 teaches that beauty is the most important quality in a woman.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:30 clearly states that favor and beauty are deceptive and vain, but a woman who fears the LORD is to be praised, placing spiritual character above outward appearance.

questions.question: True or False: According to Proverbs 31:21, a virtuous woman fears for her household and does not ensure they are properly clothed for winter.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Verse 21 says the woman is not afraid of snow because she ensures her household is clothed in scarlet, indicating her preparedness and care for her family.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 31:11 says, "The heart of her husband doth safely trust in her, so that he shall have no need of _______."
questions.correctAnswer: spoil
questions.explanation: The verse teaches that the husband's heart safely trusts the virtuous woman, and therefore he lacks no spoil, meaning he has no need to seek gain elsewhere due to her faithfulness and provision.

hard.title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Proverbs Chapter 31.

questions.question: In Proverbs 31, King Lemuel's advice to his son about not giving strength to women and ways to that which destroyeth kings (verse 3) can be seen as a warning against what in the broader ancient Near Eastern royal context?
options: The dangers of indulgence and moral weakness among rulers
The importance of strategic marriage alliances
The role of prophets in governance
questions.correctAnswer: The dangers of indulgence and moral weakness among rulers
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:3 warns against giving strength to women and ways to that which destroyeth kings, reflecting a cultural concern that indulgence, especially in sensuality or drunkenness, leads to the downfall of rulers in the ancient Near East.

questions.question: What literary device is primarily used in Proverbs 31:10-31 to describe the virtuous woman?
questions.correctAnswer: An acrostic poem
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:10-31 is famously known as an acrostic poem in Hebrew, where each verse begins with a successive letter of the Hebrew alphabet, praising the qualities of the virtuous woman.

questions.question: The phrase in Proverbs 31:30, "Favour is deceitful, and beauty is vain," reflects which theological theme found throughout Scripture?
options: The superiority of inner godly fear over external appearance
questions.correctAnswer: The superiority of inner godly fear over external appearance
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:30 emphasizes that external beauty and favor are fleeting, but a woman who fears the LORD is truly praiseworthy, echoing biblical themes that prioritize reverence for God over outward appearances (cf. 1 Samuel 16:7).

questions.question: In Proverbs 31:6-7, what is the purpose of giving strong drink to those who are ready to perish and wine to those with heavy hearts?
options: To provide comfort and forget misery
questions.correctAnswer: To provide comfort and forget misery
questions.explanation: Verses 6-7 suggest giving strong drink to those who are dying or heavy-hearted so they may forget their poverty and misery, reflecting ancient practices of using alcohol for consolation in distress.

questions.question: The exhortation in Proverbs 31:8-9 to "open thy mouth for the dumb" and "judge righteously" connects to which broader biblical justice theme?
options: Advocacy for the marginalized and righteous judgment
The king’s role as a priest
The separation of church and state
questions.correctAnswer: Advocacy for the marginalized and righteous judgment
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:8-9 calls for speaking up for those who cannot speak for themselves and judging fairly, which aligns with the biblical mandate in scriptures like Isaiah 1:17 and Micah 6:8 to defend the poor and needy.

questions.question: The description of the virtuous woman rising while it is yet night to provide for her household (Proverbs 31:15) symbolizes what cultural value in ancient Israelite society?
options: Diligence and responsibility in family care
questions.correctAnswer: Diligence and responsibility in family care
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:15 portrays the woman’s rising early to care for her household as a metaphor for her diligence and faithful stewardship, a highly valued trait in ancient Israelite culture.

questions.question: Which Hebrew words in Proverbs 31:17 convey the idea of strength and might, and how do they relate to the woman’s character?
options: Girdeth (חָגַר, chagar) and strengtheneth (עָזַר, azar) relate to preparedness and empowerment
Bless (בָּרַךְ, barak) and praise (תְּהַלֵּל, tehalel) relate to worship
Speak (דָּבַר, dabar) and teach (לָמַד, lamad) relate to wisdom
Love (אָהַב, ahav) and fear (יָרֵא, yare) relate to piety
questions.correctAnswer: Girdeth (חָגַר, chagar) and strengtheneth (עָזַר, azar) relate to preparedness and empowerment
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:17 uses the verbs חָגַר (girdeth) and עָזַר (strengtheneth) emphasizing the woman’s strength and readiness, portraying her as empowered and industrious.

questions.question: How does the depiction of the virtuous woman in Proverbs 31:16, who "considereth a field, and buyeth it," reflect ancient Israelite economic practices?
options: It shows women’s involvement in land management and commerce
It is a metaphor for spiritual stewardship only
It reflects prophetic ownership of land
It indicates royal ownership of all property
questions.correctAnswer: It shows women’s involvement in land management and commerce
questions.explanation: The verse highlights that the woman actively engages in business and property acquisition, reflecting that women could participate in economic activities in ancient Israelite society.

questions.question: The phrase "her candle goeth not out by night" (Proverbs 31:18) symbolizes what about the virtuous woman’s character?
questions.correctAnswer: Her tireless diligence and vigilance
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:18’s metaphor of an unextinguished candle represents the woman’s persistent hard work and watchfulness, a valued trait in biblical wisdom literature.

questions.question: Proverbs 31:22 describes the woman making herself coverings of tapestry and clothing of silk and purple. What does the use of purple dye signify in the ancient Near East?
questions.correctAnswer: Royalty, wealth, and high status
questions.explanation: Purple dye was rare and expensive in the ancient Near East, often associated with royalty and nobility, indicating the woman’s high social standing or refined taste as described in Proverbs 31:22.

questions.question: Which New Testament passage echoes the theme of Proverbs 31:30 about the value of fearing God over outward appearance?
questions.correctAnswer: 1 Peter 3:3-4
questions.explanation: 1 Peter 3:3-4 advises women to focus on inner beauty and a gentle and quiet spirit rather than external adornment, echoing Proverbs 31:30’s emphasis on the fear of the LORD over physical beauty.

questions.question: True or False: Proverbs 31 addresses only the domestic roles of women and does not mention their involvement in commerce or social justice.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31 describes the virtuous woman's involvement in commerce (e.g., buying fields, selling linen) and social justice (reaching out to the poor), thus encompassing wider roles than domestic duties alone (Proverbs 31:16, 20, 24).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 31:28, how do the woman's children and husband respond to her virtues?
options: They arise and call her blessed; her husband praises her
They ignore her and seek other counsel
They criticize her for being busy
They rely solely on her financial support
questions.correctAnswer: They arise and call her blessed; her husband praises her
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:28 highlights the respect and honor the woman's family gives her, showing the fruit of her godly character in relational blessings.

questions.question: What is the significance of the description in Proverbs 31:23 that her husband is known in the gates, sitting among the elders of the land?
options: It indicates the woman’s indirect influence on her husband’s public stature
It shows she has political power herself
It warns against pride in social status
It references a specific legal council
questions.correctAnswer: It indicates the woman’s indirect influence on her husband’s public stature
questions.explanation: The verse suggests that the woman’s virtues support her husband’s reputation and leadership role, implying her positive influence on his public life in the community.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Proverbs 31:26 says, "She openeth her mouth with _______; and in her tongue is the law of kindness."
questions.correctAnswer: wisdom
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:26 states that the virtuous woman speaks with wisdom and kindness, emphasizing the importance of wise and gentle speech.

theological.title: Proverbs Chapter 31 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Proverbs Chapter 31 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: According to Proverbs 31, what is the primary reason King Lemuel's mother warns him against giving his strength to women?
options: They may lead kings to destruction
Kings should focus only on war
questions.correctAnswer: They may lead kings to destruction
questions.explanation: Proverbs 31:3 warns not to give strength to women or ways to that which destroyeth kings, highlighting the potential for destructive influence. This is consistent with biblical warnings about the dangers of sinful relationships (1 Corinthians 15:33, Proverbs 5:3-6, Matthew 6:24, James 1:14-15).

questions.question: What does Proverbs 31:4-5 specify as inappropriate for kings and princes?
questions.correctAnswer: Drinking wine and strong drink
questions.explanation: Verses 4 and 5 instruct kings not to drink wine or strong drink lest they forget the law and pervert judgment, emphasizing sober leadership. Similar exhortations are found in Ephesians 5:18, 1 Timothy 3:3, and Isaiah 28:7.

questions.question: In Proverbs 31, to whom should strong drink be given according to verse 6?
options: Those ready to perish and heavy-hearted
questions.correctAnswer: Those ready to perish and heavy-hearted
questions.explanation: Verse 6 recommends strong drink for those who are perishing or heavy-hearted, indicating compassionate care for suffering. This reflects biblical concern for those in distress (Psalm 34:18, Isaiah 61:3, 2 Corinthians 1:3-4, Romans 12:15).

questions.question: What is the role of the righteous judge as described in Proverbs 31:8-9?
options: To speak up for the voiceless and judge righteously
To ignore the poor and needy
To judge based on personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: To speak up for the voiceless and judge righteously
questions.explanation: Verses 8-9 command to open the mouth for the dumb and plead for the poor, emphasizing justice and advocacy. This aligns with biblical mandates for justice (Isaiah 1:17, Micah 6:8, James 2:1-9, Luke 4:18).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 31 characterize the value of a virtuous woman?
options: Her price is far above rubies
She is only valuable for her beauty
She is known for her wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Her price is far above rubies
questions.explanation: Verse 10 states her worth exceeds rubies, emphasizing intrinsic virtue over material wealth. This corresponds with biblical esteem of godly character (1 Timothy 2:9-10, 1 Peter 3:3-4, Song of Solomon 4:7, Proverbs 22:1).

questions.question: What trust does the husband have in the virtuous woman according to Proverbs 31:11?
options: He safely trusts in her and lacks nothing of value
He depends on others for provision
He fears her power over him
He is indifferent to her actions
questions.correctAnswer: He safely trusts in her and lacks nothing of value
questions.explanation: Verse 11 highlights the husband's confident trust in her, reflecting mutual respect and security. This mirrors biblical teaching on marital trust (Ephesians 5:25-33, 1 Corinthians 7:3-4, Colossians 3:19-21, Song of Solomon 2:16).

questions.question: Which of the following activities is NOT attributed to the virtuous woman in Proverbs 31?
options: Providing food to her household early in the morning
questions.correctAnswer: Engaging in idleness
questions.explanation: Verse 27 explicitly notes she does not eat the bread of idleness, portraying diligence. The other options are affirmed in verses 13, 15, and 16. This is consistent with biblical commendation of industriousness (2 Thessalonians 3:10-12, Colossians 3:23, Ecclesiastes 9:10, Titus 2:5).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 31 describe the virtuous woman's attitude toward the poor and needy?
options: She stretches out her hand to help them
questions.correctAnswer: She stretches out her hand to help them
questions.explanation: Verse 20 states she reaches out to the poor and needy, showing compassion. This reflects biblical calls to generosity (Proverbs 19:17, Luke 14:13-14, Hebrews 13:16, Matthew 25:35-40).

questions.question: What is said about the virtuous woman's clothing in Proverbs 31:22 and 25?
options: She is clothed in strength, honor, silk, and purple
She wears only simple homespun garments
She dresses in costly gold and jewels
questions.correctAnswer: She is clothed in strength, honor, silk, and purple
questions.explanation: Verses 22 and 25 describe her fine clothing and metaphorical garments of strength and honor, signifying dignity and capability. This imagery parallels biblical symbolism of righteousness as clothing (Isaiah 61:10, Revelation 19:8, Psalm 45:13, Zechariah 3:4-5).

questions.question: According to Proverbs 31:26, what are the qualities of the virtuous woman's speech?
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom and kindness
questions.explanation: Verse 26 says she opens her mouth with wisdom and the law of kindness is on her tongue, highlighting godly speech. This aligns with biblical exhortations on edifying speech (Ephesians 4:29, Colossians 4:6, James 3:17, Proverbs 15:1).

questions.question: What does Proverbs 31:28 reveal about the response of the virtuous woman's family to her?
options: Her children and husband call her blessed and praise her
questions.correctAnswer: Her children and husband call her blessed and praise her
questions.explanation: Verse 28 shows her family honors and praises her, indicating the fruit of her godly life. This is consistent with biblical principles of honoring godly parents and spouses (Ephesians 6:1-3, 1 Peter 3:7, Proverbs 23:25, Colossians 3:20).

questions.question: What does Proverbs 31:30 highlight as the true quality for which a woman is praised?
options: A woman who fears the LORD
questions.correctAnswer: A woman who fears the LORD
questions.explanation: Verse 30 contrasts fleeting favor and beauty with the enduring praise due to a woman who fears God, emphasizing reverence for God as paramount. This reflects biblical teaching on the fear of the Lord as the beginning of wisdom (Psalm 111:10, Ecclesiastes 12:13, 1 Peter 3:4, Proverbs 9:10).

questions.question: How does Proverbs 31 describe the virtuous woman's approach to managing her household?
options: She looks well to the ways of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness
She delegates all responsibility to others
She relies solely on her husband for provision
questions.correctAnswer: She looks well to the ways of her household and does not eat the bread of idleness
questions.explanation: Verse 27 states she oversees her household diligently and does not live in idleness, depicting responsible stewardship. Biblical texts affirm faithful management of the home (Titus 2:5, 1 Timothy 5:14, Proverbs 12:27, 1 Corinthians 14:40).

questions.question: Which metaphor is used in Proverbs 31:14 to describe the virtuous woman's industriousness in procuring food for her household?
options: She is like the merchants' ships bringing food from afar
She is like a bird gathering twigs
She is like a farmer plowing the field
She is like a shepherd tending sheep
questions.correctAnswer: She is like the merchants' ships bringing food from afar
questions.explanation: Verse 14 compares her to merchant ships bringing provisions from distant places, illustrating resourcefulness. This metaphor highlights diligence and provision, consistent with biblical images of fruitful labor (Genesis 41:34-36, John 6:12-13, Matthew 25:14-30, Luke 16:10).

questions.question: What is the significance of the virtuous woman's lamp not going out by night as mentioned in Proverbs 31:18?
options: It symbolizes her diligence and vigilance
It means she is afraid of the dark
It shows she works only during the day
questions.correctAnswer: It symbolizes her diligence and vigilance
questions.explanation: Verse 18 notes her lamp does not go out at night, symbolizing constant diligence and care. This reflects biblical commendation of watchfulness and perseverance (Psalm 119:105, Luke 12:35-36, Romans 12:11, Proverbs 20:13).
